FILE: cm100710v11.0.txt
DYAD: COLOMBIA - CHINA
RIVALRY: RIV271
DISPUTE(S): MID51 

PSNOTES: 

PS-LAST-CHANGED: 20170720
PS-LAST-CHECKED: 20170803


Territorial-Maritime-Boundary Issues Variables


MID51 

TERRMID: MID51 3 -- not territory
TERRMID-CER: MID51 1 -- certain 
TERRMID-NOTES: 

TERRLINK: MID51 1 -- third party link to territorial MID 
TERRLINK-CER: MID51 1 -- certain
TERRLINK-NOTES: MID51 from cm002710v11.0 narrative, this is the Korean War. The primary disputants were North and South Korea, and this was a territorial MID. UN forces fought with South Korea against North Korea and China. Colombia was a part of the UN forces, and China was assisting North Korea, pulling each into this MID. Coded third party link to territory because Colombia and China experienced a MID here due to the Korean War, a territorial MID.

MARITMID: MID51 3 -- not maritime 
MARITMID-CER: MID51 1 -- certain
MARITMID-NOTES: 

ISLMID: MID51 3 -- not islands 
ISLMID-CER: MID51 1 -- certain
ISLMID-NOTES: 

CIVWARMID: MID51 3 -- civil war 
CIVWARMID-CER: MID51 1 -- certain
CIVWARMID-NOTES: MID51 Although this MID involves civil war, no member of this dyad experience civil conflict.

CIVWARLINK: MID51 1 -- civil war link
CIVWARLINK-CER: MID51 1 -- certain
CIVWARLINK-NOTES: MID51 the Korean War also has a civil war element. This is coded civil war link because the civil war between North and South Korea, both outside of this dyad, pulled Colombia and China into this MID. 

COUPMID: MID51 3 -- not coup 
COUPMID-CER: MID51 1 -- certain 
COUPMID-NOTES: 

COUPLINK: MID51 3 -- not coup link
COUPLINK-CER: MID51 1 -- certain 
COUPLINK-NOTES: 


RIVNOTES:
